body:
### Problem

On neovim 0.11.3 with eclpise java language server (jdtls), the hover ("K") works, but in the master branch, all hover requests result in `vim.notify("Empty hover response")` happening.

If I revert #35423 then hover works again. This change causes all jdtls hover responses to be treated as empty.

### Steps to reproduce

Create standalone `Example.java` using jdtls:
```java
/** doc comment */
public class Example {}
```

Press K on "Example".

The LSP requests and responses are the same for both versions, but all `jdtls` responses are now treated as empty:

```
neovim 0.11.3: (works)

[DEBUG][2025-08-27 16:41:30] ...m/lsp/client.lua:674	"LSP[jdtls]"	"client.request"	2	"textDocument/hover"	{ position = { character = 14, line = 1 }, textDocument = { uri = "file:///home/rmuir/hover_repro/Example.java" } }	<function 1>	1
[DEBUG][2025-08-27 16:41:30] .../vim/lsp/rpc.lua:277	"rpc.send"	{ id = 23, jsonrpc = "2.0", method = "textDocument/hover", params = { position = { character = 14, line = 1 }, textDocument = { uri = "file:///home/rmuir/hover_repro/Example.java" } } }
[DEBUG][2025-08-27 16:41:30] .../vim/lsp/rpc.lua:391	"rpc.receive"	{ id = 23, jsonrpc = "2.0", result = { contents = { { language = "java", value = "Example" }, "doc comment" } } }

neovim 0.12: "Empty hover response"

[DEBUG][2025-08-27 16:43:38] /usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/log.lua:151	"LSP[jdtls]"	"client.request"	2	"textDocument/hover"	{ position = { character = 14, line = 1 }, textDocument = { uri = "file:///home/rmuir/hover_repro/Example.java" } }	<function 1>	1
[DEBUG][2025-08-27 16:43:38] /usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/log.lua:151	"rpc.send"	{ id = 14, jsonrpc = "2.0", method = "textDocument/hover", params = { position = { character = 14, line = 1 }, textDocument = { uri = "file:///home/rmuir/hover_repro/Example.java" } } }
[DEBUG][2025-08-27 16:43:39] /usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/log.lua:151	"rpc.receive"	{ id = 14, jsonrpc = "2.0", result = { contents = { { language = "java", value = "Example" }, "doc comment" } } }
```

This reproducer could be substantially improved, but I'm hoping this problematic response is easier to turn into a test case than to instruct how to wrestle jdtls:
```lua
{ 
  id = 14, 
  jsonrpc = "2.0",
  result = { 
    contents = {
      { 
        language = "java", 
        value = "Example"
      },
      "doc comment"
    }
  }
}
```


### Expected behavior

Hover works again :)

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

v0.12.0-dev-1100+gc1e7ce9d79

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A

### Operating system/version

Linux 6.16.3

### Terminal name/version

ghostty

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-ghostty

### Installation

make
title: #35423 treats all jdtls hover responses as "Empty hover response"
